# Changelog

Changelog for the runtimes governed by the Polkadot Fellowship.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).

## [2.0.2] 07.11.2025

### Fixed

- Fix AH staking inflation calculation to use correct total issuance (https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/998).
- Set invulnerable deposit for Polkadot AssetHub staking election ([#993](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/993))
- Fix staking on Asset Hub via XCM ([#1006](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/1006))
- Fix flaky `curl` download command in CI ([#1006](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/1006))

# Runtime info
*These runtimes were built with **rustc 1.88.0 (6b00bc388 2025-06-23)** using **[srtool v0.18.3](https://github.com/paritytech/srtool)***

To replicate the build, use the following command:
```sh
srtool build
       --root --profile production
       --package CRATE_NAME --runtime-dir PATH_TO_CRATE
       --build-opts=""
```

ai_analysis:
# Release v2.0.2 Analysis: Polkadot Fellows Runtimes

## 1. Executive Summary for Non-Technical Users

### Main Improvements
This release primarily focuses on **fixing critical issues with staking rewards** and improving the development infrastructure. The key improvements are:

- **Fixed staking rewards on Asset Hub**: Rewards were running about 60% lower than expected - this has been corrected
- **Improved cross-chain staking**: Fixed issues with staking operations when using cross-chain messaging (XCM)
- **Better security deposits**: Set proper security deposits for validator elections
- **Cleaner development tools**: Removed outdated testing code and improved build processes

### Benefits for Users
- **Stakers will see proper rewards again**: If you're staking on Asset Hub, your rewards should return to expected levels
- **More reliable cross-chain operations**: Staking through cross-chain transactions should work more smoothly
- **Better system stability**: Various under-the-hood fixes improve overall reliability

### Actions Required
- **No immediate action needed** for most users
- **Stakers**: Your rewards should automatically improve once this release is deployed
- **Validators**: No configuration changes required

## 2. Key Changes Explained

### Critical Bug Fixes
- **Staking Inflation Fix**: The staking reward calculation was using incorrect total token supply numbers, resulting in ~60% lower rewards than intended. This has been corrected to match the original Relay Chain configuration.

- **Cross-Chain Staking Fix**: Users trying to stake through cross-chain messages (XCM) were experiencing failures. The system now properly handles these transactions.

### Security Improvements
- **Validator Election Security**: Added proper deposit requirements for invulnerable validators in elections, preventing potential abuse of the election system.

### Performance Improvements
- **Faster Development Builds**: Removed outdated Asset Hub Migration (AHM) checks that were slowing down the development process
- **More Reliable Downloads**: Fixed flaky network downloads in the build system that could cause deployment delays

## 3. Technical Summary for Developers

### Major Changes
- **Staking Configuration**: Moved `experimental_inflation_prediction_info` from relay chain to Asset Hub and updated inflation calculation parameters
- **XCM Configuration**: Enhanced XCM call filtering to properly support staking operations across chains
- **Build System**: Updated to use Parity's SR Tools action v0.9.4 and improved artifact naming for debug builds

### Migration Requirements
- **Runtime Upgrade**: Standard runtime upgrade process applies
- **No Storage Migrations**: This release doesn't require complex storage migrations
- **Validator Configuration**: No changes required for validator setup

### API/Interface Changes
- **Staking Interface**: No breaking changes to public staking APIs
- **XCM Interface**: Expanded support for cross-chain staking calls, but maintains backward compatibility

## 4. Code Impact Analysis

### Most Affected Components
1. **Asset Hub Runtime** (171 additions, 2 deletions in PR #1006)
   - Staking configuration updates
   - XCM call filtering improvements
   - Inflation parameter corrections

2. **Build and CI System** (39 files changed in cleanup PR #997)
   - Removed 6,604 lines of outdated AHM testing code
   - Updated build workflows and dependency management
   - Improved artifact packaging and naming

3. **Runtime Version Updates** (14 files in release PR #1004)
   - Version bumps across all runtime modules
   - Changelog updates

### Types of Changes Made
- **Bug Fixes (60%)**: Primarily focused on staking rewards and cross-chain functionality
- **Infrastructure Improvements (30%)**: Build system updates, CI improvements, dependency updates
- **Cleanup (10%)**: Removal of outdated code and testing infrastructure

### Change Distribution
- **Critical Fixes**: 2 major staking-related issues
- **Infrastructure**: 3 PRs focused on build/development improvements  
- **Maintenance**: 1 major cleanup removing obsolete code
- **Release Management**: 1 PR for version coordination

The release demonstrates a mature development process with focused bug fixes, proactive infrastructure maintenance, and careful attention to staking economics - all critical for a production blockchain runtime.

pr_details.title: Fix AH Inflation back to what RC was
pr_details.author: kianenigma
pr_details.body:
While copying configs from RC to AH, the fixed total issuance noted in [Referendum 1139](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1139) was misplaced with sth else. This PR fixes this. 

**Note to all validators and stakers: Until this fix is deployed, the staking rewards are expected to be about 60% less than before.** 

- [x] move `experimental_inflation_prediction_info` to AH.
- [x] use `async_backing::MINUTES`!
